docs.abstract: In 2020, JPMorgan pledged to invest significant resources in closing the racial wealth gap. Here is what the bank did, and what it looks like when a private-sector company tries to fix a societal problem.
docs.snippet: In 2020, JPMorgan pledged to invest significant resources in closing the racial wealth gap. Here is what the bank did, and what it looks like when a private-sector company tries to fix a societal problem.
docs.lead_paragraph: It seemed like a big number.

headline.main: Where $30 Billion to Fix Systemic Racism Actually Goes
headline.print_headline: Anatomy of a $30 Billion Pledge to Close the Wealth Gap

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The White Wall: How Big Finance Bankrupts Black America (Book)

docs.abstract: Samson Kambalu’s “Antelope,” a towering bronze sculpture that sits prominently in Trafalgar Square, revisits an old question: Who gets to wear a hat?
docs.snippet: Samson Kambalu’s “Antelope,” a towering bronze sculpture that sits prominently in Trafalgar Square, revisits an old question: Who gets to wear a hat?
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Samson Kambalu, a British multimedia artist who was born in Malawi, is asking his adoptive nation to examine an uncomfortable colonial past, along with its present, in the age of Black Lives Matter.

headline.main: A London Monument to Equality, Inspired by an Act of Defiance

docs.abstract: John Sides and Lynn Vavreck share what they’ve learned for the midterms and beyond.
docs.snippet: John Sides and Lynn Vavreck share what they’ve learned for the midterms and beyond.
docs.lead_paragraph: How does the popularity of a president’s policies impact his or her party’s electoral chances? Why have Latinos — and other voters of color — swung toward the Republican Party in recent years? How does the state of the economy influence how people vote, and which economic metrics in particular matter most?

headline.main: These Political Scientists Surveyed 500,000 Voters. Here Are Their Unnerving Conclusions.

docs.abstract: In the longer contest to tell the better story about America and draw people into that story, there is a great worry among organizers that the left is badly falling short.
docs.snippet: In the longer contest to tell the better story about America and draw people into that story, there is a great worry among organizers that the left is badly falling short.
docs.lead_paragraph: Polls swing this way and that way, but the larger story they tell is unmistakable. With the midterm elections, Americans are being offered a clear choice between continued and expanded liberal democracy, on the one hand, and fascism, on the other. And it’s more or less a dead heat.

headline.main: The Uncomfortable Truths That Could Yet Defeat Fascism

docs.abstract: Among white working-class voters in places like northeast Pennsylvania, the Democratic Party has both the furthest to fall and the most to gain.
docs.snippet: Among white working-class voters in places like northeast Pennsylvania, the Democratic Party has both the furthest to fall and the most to gain.
docs.lead_paragraph: Follow our live coverage of the 2022 midterm elections for the latest news and updates.

headline.main: The Battle for Blue-Collar White Voters Raging in Biden’s Birthplace
headline.print_headline: Fight Over the White Working Class in Pennsylvania
